Sentencas: Electrochemical oxidative coupling of methane (E-OCM) with Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6-5 (SFM) catalyst is demonstrated with metal-supported solid oxide cells (MS-SOC).
Titulo: Electrochemical conversion of methane to ethylene, olefins, and paraffins using metal-supported solid oxide cells

Sentencas: SFM anode and Pr6O11 cathode catalysts are loaded into a porous symmetric-architecture cell by infiltration and firing.
Titulo: Electrochemical conversion of methane to ethylene, olefins, and paraffins using metal-supported solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The most effective chelating agent (citric acid/ethyl glycol) and optimal firing/ reducing temperatures (850 degrees C/750 degrees C) for the SFM catalyst precursor solution are selected and confirmed by cell testing.
Titulo: Electrochemical conversion of methane to ethylene, olefins, and paraffins using metal-supported solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Operating temperature, cell voltage, and oxygen concentration at the cathode greatly affect the methane conversion rate and product selectivity by controlling the oxygen ion flow.
Titulo: Electrochemical conversion of methane to ethylene, olefins, and paraffins using metal-supported solid oxide cells

Sentencas: CH4 conversion of 85.8% is obtained, with C2H4, C2H6, and H2 concentrations of 10.5%, 12.3%, and 25.6% at 800 degrees C, respectively, in the product exhaust gas.
Titulo: Electrochemical conversion of methane to ethylene, olefins, and paraffins using metal-supported solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Reasonable stability of the current density and methane conversion is demonstrated during 200 h operation.
Titulo: Electrochemical conversion of methane to ethylene, olefins, and paraffins using metal-supported solid oxide cells

Sentencas: This research demonstrates technical progress in catalyst and device development for the E-OCM reaction to synthesize valuable chemicals.(c) 2023 Hydrogen Energy Publications LLC.
Titulo: Electrochemical conversion of methane to ethylene, olefins, and paraffins using metal-supported solid oxide cells
